name: Kadavu Resort & Ayurveda Center

reviews.text: One of the calm and peaceful resort i have been to. The hotel restaurant overlooked the river and coconut trees are everywhere. The room was just ok.
reviews.title: A peaceful resort by the river

reviews.text: It is far and away Kozhikode's most beautiful resort. Located atop a mound by the river side, it offers some the finest sights you'll see in these parts. From my balcony view, the gently flowing river with coconut groves all round was as soothing a sight as any. This is an ideal resort to let loose your hair. Slightly out of town, it is the ideal base to check out north Kerala. These backwaters are in many ways just as beautiful as their southern Kerala counterpart in Allappey. It is far less crowded and as picturesque.Do not miss the ayurvedic treatment here. It is really rejuvenating. The pool water can get a little too warm in May but for the rest, this is just about perfect.
reviews.title: High over a River

reviews.text: Our first view of this hotel from the reception area was across the lovely gardens and pool. Our room looked across the river and other rooms looked over the pool and fountain.
reviews.title: Not a 5-star hotel

reviews.text: We had lunch on the restaurant terrace which also looks over the river. Two of our party had steak, advertised as fillet, but which the chef finally admitted was rump - it tasted fine so why call it fillet?
reviews.title: Great Scenic View
i have a very different opinion on Kadavu
reviews.text: The bathroom light didn't work in our room but a man came from housekeeping very promptly and changed the whole thing.
you can find stunning views, delicious food, great value for money, a fantastic atmosphere, and the hospitality at its best.

reviews.title: Had a Great Time

reviews.text: • Swimming Pools: they have a large swimming pool with it’s own ozone treatment plant, a Jacuzzi and a small paddling pool for kids.
reviews.title: Scenic Paradise

reviews.text: Located on the banks of the river, facing a small island covered with coconut trees, the hotel makes good use of the view and the serene surroundings. The hotel is just off the highway, but sights and sounds of the road are somehow not very intrusive.
reviews.title: Beautiful Location, Rooms need renovation

reviews.text: We stayed in the standard room which has a large balcony overlooking the river, and you can spend hours sitting there relaxing over a book or a drink.
reviews.title: A good resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food is reasonably good, though a tad expensive for the place. Old bathrooms need renovation and the public areas could also do with some sprucing up. Service is hit-or-miss. Room service order was delivered quickly but our request for an extra towel and tea bags was forgotten the first two times. Arrived on the third try. Staff cleared the room service tray but didn't clear the used tea cups.
reviews.title: Not my favourite hotel in Kerala

reviews.text: The gym is reasonably well-equipped but dirty and poorly maintained. The pool is clean and very usable, though.
reviews.title: decent place but expensive

reviews.text: The grounds are fairly large and there's a walking track by the river and a boat jetty where you can hire a boat for a backwater ride. They also have a houseboat for overnight stays.
reviews.title: Hospitality and good location hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gorgeous resort, stayed in standard room which was more modern and more recently renovated (with flat screen tv), than the river view room that we were shown. Pool was fabulous with sunloungers and towels. There was an outside bar/restaurant with fantastic views down the river. They sold finger chips, quite a find, and make a change from curry for lunch! We ordered a chicken tikka for dinner which they made specially for us and was mouth-wateringly tastey. I am now also quite addicted to kingfisher beer.
reviews.title: Fabulous pool, fabulous massage, faulous views, idillic spot

reviews.text: Great bed with white bedding, kettle in room, good shower. We stayed for 3 days 2 nights. Only 20 minutes from airport, but you would never know. Would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Over rated and at best a 2 star, India's own Faulty Towers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Such a poor and disappointing hotel. Broken toilet seat, bathrooms not particularly clean.
reviews.title: Great houseboat experience

likes.liked: — Amazing overall experience of a houseboat and the beautiful backwaters

reviews.text: Pool area a joke, dreadful patio, no member of staff to move heavy and outdated pool furniture. Rude and unhelpful staff, food less than satisfactory. Spa seems antiquated. Wi Fi set up was dreadful and problematic. The list is endless.....
reviews.title: Beautiful get away

reviews.text: I travel extensively throughout India, and do not recommend this hotel if you require any sort of luxury..

description: Located on the banks of River Chailyar, Kadavu Resort & Ayurveda Center offers you a unique getaway. Kadavu offers you a range of accommodation ranging from Rooms, Cottages, Suites & even option of staying on a House boat.The food & beverage options include *Oottupura, The Multi- Cuisine Coffee shop serving Buffet Breakfast,ala-carte orders for lunch and dinner.. Zirkon, The Cocktail Lounge, where one can enjoy a range of beverages with breathtaking views of Chaliyar River.*Makkani, The Malabari Specialty Restaurant is our tribute to the culinary treasures of Malabar. Experience the flavours of Malabar in an earthy ambiance enjoying the gentle breeze from the river.Kadavu Ayurveda Center, which is green leaf certified, offers Authentic Ayurveda therapies in a picturesque setting.
